org.jsfml.window

Class Joystick

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsfml.window.Joystick

  • public final class Joystick
extends Object
    Provides access to the the real-time states of joysticks and gamepads.

    The methods in this class provide direct access to the joystick state, that means that they work independently of a window's focus. In order to react to window based events, use the Window.pollEvents() method instead.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Joystick.Axis
      Enumeration of supported joystick and gamepad axes.

    • Field Detail

      • JOYSTICK_COUNT

        public static final int JOYSTICK_COUNT
        The maximum amount of supported joysticks and gamepads.

        Joystick identifiers are guaranteed to be smaller than this value.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BUTTON_COUNT

        public static final int BUTTON_COUNT
        The maximum amount of supported joystick and gamepad buttons.

        Joystick button indices are guaranteed to be smaller than this value.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • isConnected

        public static boolean isConnected(int joystick)
        Checks if a joystick or gamepad is currently connected.
        Parameters:
        joystick - the index of the joystick to check. This value must range between 0 (inclusive) and #JOYSTICK_COUNT (exclusive).
        Returns:
        true if the joystick or gamepad is currently connected, false otherwise.

      • getButtonCount

        public static int getButtonCount(int joystick)
        Retrieves the amount of buttons of a joystick or gamepad.
        Parameters:
        joystick - the index of the joystick in question. This value must range between 0 (inclusive) and #JOYSTICK_COUNT (exclusive).
        Returns:
        the amount of buttons of the joystick.

      • hasAxis

        public static boolean hasAxis(int joystick,
              Joystick.Axis axis)
        Checks whether a joystick or gamepad supports the specified axis.
        Parameters:
        joystick - the index of the joystick in question. This value must range between 0 (inclusive) and #JOYSTICK_COUNT (exclusive).
        axis - the axis to look for.
        Returns:
        true if the joystick or gamepad supports the given axis, false otherwise.

      • isButtonPressed

        public static boolean isButtonPressed(int joystick,
                      int button)
        Checks whether the specified button is currently pressed on a joystick or gamepad.
        Parameters:
        joystick - the index of the joystick in question. This value must range between 0 (inclusive) and #JOYSTICK_COUNT (exclusive).
        button - the index of the button to check. This value must range between 0 (inclusive) and #BUTTON_COUNT (exclusive).
        Returns:
        true if the button is currently pressed on the joystick or gamepad, false otherwise.

      • getAxisPosition

        public static float getAxisPosition(int joystick,
                    Joystick.Axis axis)
        Retrieves the current position of the specified axis of a joystick or gamepad.
        Parameters:
        joystick - the index of the joystick in question. This value must range between 0 (inclusive) and #JOYSTICK_COUNT (exclusive).
        axis - the axis in question.
        Returns:
        a floating point number ranging between -100 and 100, denoting the current position of the axis. If the joystick or gamepad is not connected or does not support the specified axis, 0 is returned.

      • update

        public static void update()
        Forces an update of the states of all joysticks and gamepads.

        This method is only required if the joystick state needs to be known before a window has been created. Once there is a window, the states will be automatically updated in regular periods.
